sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: What is the area of a sector of a circle with a radius of 7 cm and a central angle of 60°?
message_2:
To find the area of a sector of a circle, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (Central angle/360°) × π × (radius)^2

In this case, the central angle is 60° and the radius is 7 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Area of sector = (60°/360°) × π × (7 cm)^2
Area of sector = (1/6) × π × 49 cm^2
Area of sector = (49π/6) cm^2

The area of the sector is (49π/6) square centimeters.
